title: Amazon KDP Keyword Research Helium 10 Tutorial - Steal Your Competitors Keywords, Low & No Content

tactics.name: Competitor Keyword Analysis
tactics.description: Use Helium 10's X-ray tool to analyze competitors' book listings and extract keyword data.
steps: Perform Amazon search and use X-ray to aggregate competitor data
Analyze ASINs, BSR, revenue, and sponsored ads
caveats: Does not include sponsored listings in aggregate totals
source_quotes: 'the term unicorn coloring book gets searched for 7,751 times'

tactics.name: Competitor Keyword Stealing
tactics.description: Analyze top-selling books in your niche to steal their keywords and replicate their keyword strategy using Helium 10 and Cerebro.
steps: Select top-selling ASINs based on sales volume
Use Helium 10 to gather keywords from competitors
Filter keywords by search volume and competition
Prioritize keywords with low competition and high search volume
caveats: Avoid analyzing low-performing books with no sales
source_quotes: we want keywords that people are actually searching for

heuristics.name: Sponsored Ad Detection
heuristics.condition: If a listing appears in the bottom results but has high revenue, it's likely running sponsored ads
source_quotes: 'these are the books that are running ads quite often'

heuristics.name: Low-Competition Targeting
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has less than 2 competitors and 500+ monthly searches, prioritize it
source_quotes: we want the ones that have two books or less ranking in the top 10 results

heuristics.name: Spanish Keyword Advantage
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has a Spanish translation with lower competition, prioritize it
source_quotes: search results to be in different languages in particular in spanish

heuristics.name: High Search Volume/Low Competition
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has high search volume and low competition, prioritize it
source_quotes: anger management workbook for women it's got a huge iq score

claims.statement: KDP differs from FBA in that books aren't printed until sold
source_quotes: 'amazon doesn't actually print your book until you make the sale'

claims.statement: 70% of shoppers never click past the first page of Amazon search results
source_quotes: 70 percent of shoppers never click past the first page

claims.statement: Books ranking for Spanish keywords can achieve top positions despite high competition in English searches
source_quotes: this book is targeting spanish keywords same with these animals for toddler

claims.statement: Amazon provides recommended keywords for top-ranking books
source_quotes: this search or this filter brings up 10 keywords that this particular book ranks for that amazon agrees are good keywords to use

claims.statement: Non-KDP books compete directly with KDP books for keyword rankings
source_quotes: this is not a kdp book it is published elsewhere but i don't think that that even matters

niche_patterns.description: Target specific demographics with niche constraints for low-content books
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines identity (teen boys) with problem (ADHD) and constraint (Christian values) for focused keyword opportunities

niche_patterns.example: coloring books for girls + Spanish keywords
niche_patterns.description: Target underserved language markets with niche products to reduce competition
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages multilingual search demand while avoiding crowded English keyword spaces
signals: high search volume in target language
source_quotes: look at using keywords in different languages starting with spanish
